title: Java Arrays
subject: Java
theory:
An array is a collection of similar type of elements which has contiguous memory location.
In Java, arrays are Objects.
They are fixed in size.

examples.explanation: length is a property (field), not a method `length()`.

common_mistakes.correction: `System.out.println(arr)` prints memory hashcode. Use `Arrays.toString(arr)` to see values.

interview_questions.question: Are arrays primitive or objects?
interview_questions.answer: Objects. They are dynamically created classes.

practice_problems.problem: Find the sum of all elements in array.

real_world_use_cases.description: Images are stored as 2D or 3D arrays of pixel values.

exam_notes: Array elements are auto-initialized to default values (0, null).
Can't resize an array once created.
summary: Arrays are the most basic data structure. Fast, but inflexible size.
